Just have fun.

First of all, which group do you want to follow?

11.title: Blood Saints

choices: Santiago sets his plan into action.
1111.content:
The abandoned museum had been a home to the Blood Saints for half a century. There had never been a more perfect haven for vampires than this museum. Old, and Victorian in style, it had at one time been a mansion. Home to some rich family who collected artifacts and antiques. They'd turned their home into a museum. And Santiago had turned them into corpses.

Each of the Blood Saints had their own room, with plenty to spare. A ballroom sat at the front of the building, with a chandelier that was older than the house hanging from the ceiling. There was a kitchen, a pool room, though it was drained of water and they used it instead as a mini-torture chamber when the time called for it, and servants quarters. The perfect vampire haven.

Santiago had claimed the master suite as his own. A bed sat at the far corner, having long ago stopped needing the use of a coffin. Pillows and cushions lined the room and he'd set up a bar on the left side. It was his haven. Few were allowed inside without his permission.

Vega was the only one who came and went as she pleased.

"I had thought this was virgin blood," Vega said in a low voice as she poured blood from a flask into a wine glass. "But the bitch was lying to me."

Santiago smirked as Vega took the glass in her hand and sauntered over to where he lay in the middle of the room, surrounded by pillows and cushions. He'd taken his shirt off and now only wore black pants. Vega sat herself in front of him, holding the cup out to him. He took it and swashed it around in his mouth the way one would do with wine. Satisfied, he took a drink and then set it aside.

Leaning forward, he lay his head in Vega's lap. Her fishnet stockings dug into the side of his face. She ran her hands down his head and over his body. "You're tense, love," she observed.

"I should be in rule over this city," he growled, deep in his throat. Vega continued to run her hands over him, every now and again digging her nails into him, the way he liked.

"The immortals of this city fear you," Vega told him, bending down and kissing his neck. Her red hair fell over his face and he brushed it away, letting her kiss and bite him. Though he barely seemed to notice. His mind was elsewhere.

"Fear is not enough," he said.

Vega stopped for a second, looking down at his face. "It has always worked before," she said.

Santiago rolled onto his back and looked up at the ceiling, feeling Vega's hands continue to pet him, playing with the belt around his waist. "Fear only rules when the fearful have no one else to turn to." With sudden fury, he slammed his fist into the floor and sat up, making Vega back up, her eyes flashing in lust at his fury. "And it is useless when there is one who stands against it and rallies others to do so as well."

Vega, who was now seated in back of him, wrapped her arms around his shoulders, kissing and biting at his neck, her hands running over his bare chest, leaving red scratches in their wake. "Are we talking about Aubrey?" she asked between kisses as her hands made their way down his stomach.

Santiago growled and grabbed her wrists with one hand, turning around to face her, he held onto them tightly, squeezing with more force than what was necessary. Vega didn't seem phased, instead she was smiling, anticipating his anger and enjoying the way it made his body glow. "He is a thorn in my side," Santiago spat through grit teeth, anger coursing through him at just the thought of the other vampire. Aubrey was still a fledgling compared to Santiago. Yet he had caused more problems than any vampire Santiago had ever come across.

Unlike Santiago, Aubrey used a different approach to get people to do his bidding. He used friendship, diplomacy, and a vow of a safe haven to find allies. It drove Santiago mad. For every vampire he scared into complacency, Aubrey gave two more a place to feel safe.

"A mighty big one," Vega answered and pushed her body towards his, though his grip on her wrists prevented her from getting too close. "What will you do about it?" she whispered into his ear.

"Remove it."
1111.title: Santiago

1112.content:
The abandoned museum had been a home to the Blood Saints for half a century. There had never been a more perfect haven for vampires than this museum. Old, and Victorian in style, it had at one time been a mansion. Home to some rich family who collected artifacts and antiques. They'd turned their home into a museum. And Santiago had turned them into corpses.

Each of the Blood Saints had their own room, with plenty to spare. A ballroom sat at the front of the building, with a chandelier that was older than the house hanging from the ceiling. There was a kitchen, a pool room, though it was drained of water and they used it instead as a mini-torture chamber when the time called for it, and servants quarters. The perfect vampire haven.

Maddock had claimed a room on the upper level. A small one, with a window that he painted black to keep out the sun. Aside from his coffin, which he used more out of habit than necessity, there was only a small altar and a wall of weapons in his room. The altar was covered in candles, pendants, and crosses. Crosses had no effect on vampires, something to which Maddock was forever thankful for.

Maddock was a vampire who believed in God.

Not only believed, but worshipped. He spent his free time praying to God to forgive him for his sins. Greed and Lust mostly, but sometimes Maddock knew not what to ask forgiveness from other than what he'd become. In his mind, a vampire was a living sin. And if he was a constant sin, then he would pray as much as he could in hopes that if he still had a soul, God would accept it when he finally died.

But just because he was a God believing vampire, it didn't mean that he refrained from killing or doing whatever Santiago asked of him. Santiago, the leader of the Blood Saints, paid Maddock to be his second in command. And the pay was high enough that Maddock didn't question his orders. He didn't question, he didn't flinch and he didn't hesitate. If Santiago said to kill someone, Maddock would kill them and he'd get pleasure out of doing so. If someone else were to offer him a better deal, more money to be their second in command, Maddock wouldn't have a problem turning on Santiago.

In between doing Santiago's will, Maddock stuck to himself. Occasionally he'd hunt to fulfill his blood lust or find a good fuck when he felt like it, but for the most part, he was a loner.

Now, Maddock sat in his room, waiting for Santiago to call him. The porcelain mask over his face glinted in the faint candlelight of the altar. Only his blue eyes could be seen through the small slits in the mask. He got up and chose a knife from the wall of weapons before sitting back down.

Twirling the knife in his fingers, he began his prayer. "Heavenly father..." and as he said the words, he carved crosses into his skin and watched as they healed seconds after he finished carving them.
1112.title: Maddock

1121.content:
Nox liked to hunt in the inner city. It was a bit more dangerous than the suburbs or the outskirts of the city because the inner city never seemed to sleep. There was always someone out and about and it was hard to keep feeding a private thing, especially if the food fought back.

But Nox liked it. He used the steam from the sewers as cover. He could stand in the same spot for hours, waiting for the perfect victim to come along instead of choosing out of necessity. He could go for what he was hungry for. Tonight, Nox was hungry for something seasoned. A woman, preferably, who had a few years under her belt. Something classy.

Santiago didn't care whether Nox killed his victims or not. Most Blood Saints did. They drank, they raped, and they killed. But Nox liked to leave them alive if he could. And he didn't rape. That wasn't his style. He could get a girl if he really wanted one, he wasn't about to just start fucking every girl who walked his way. No, Nox would lure them in with his vampiric powers. He'd catch their eye and they'd come to him. He'd feed, taking as much as he could without leaving any permanent damage, then he'd let them go. He'd watch as they shook themselves out of the trance and walked, usually a little drunkenly from blood loss, home wondering where they got the bruise on their neck.

It was the way Nox did business.

After an hour or so of watching people walk by his hiding spot, he finally caught sight of someone who would suit him good. A woman in her thirties, hair pulled tightly back in a bun, clad in a dress suit with a portfolio tucked under one arm. A business woman. She would be perfect.

Using his vampire speed to run to an alleyway a little ahead of her, he stood near the edge, waiting for her to come closer as he made his vampire presence known to her. It was what lured victims to vampires in the first place. A sort of tingle on the back of their necks that make them look around. The feeling of being watched. It was the vampire presence.

Like he anticipated, she slowed down, frowning as she looked around her, sensing him but not really knowing it. Finally, she turned her head his way and as soon as her eyes met his, he knew he had her. She stopped wallking completely. He grinned, keeping her eye contact. Then he backed down the alley, beckoning her to come and she did. She followed slowly, expressionless. He moved behind a dumpster and she came to him, standing in front of him, never breaking eye contact.

Nox flashed his fangs as he took her portfolio and set it on the ground. Afterall, she was a business woman, he respected that, he didn't want to mess with her work. Then he held onto one of her shoulders and with the other hand, tilted her head to the side, exposing her slender neck. He could see the blood pumping through her veins. What a delicacy.
1121.title: Nox

choices: Nox convinces her to go home
Nox let’s her come with him
11212.content:
Nox was just about to sink his fangs into her neck when his senses told him he was no longer alone. He looked up just in time to see Mingmei descending along a fire escape. “Min!” he hissed “What are you doing here?”

The graceful shifter dropped the last few feet to the ground and silently padded over to Nox. “Santiago let me out to stretch my legs, said my pacing was getting on his nerves.” She stood right behind his current meal and gave her the once over. “She looks yummy.” She licked her own ruby lips. “Can I watch?”

Nox shrugs. “Knock yourself out.” He bites the business woman’s neck, and she moans as he begins to dine on her blood. She’s better than he expected, her blood an excellent vintage that is pure, unmarred by drugs, or excess fat. A sweet tasting treat, better than most that he’s found in this city. Truly he’d made a good choice.

He’s just finished with her when he notes that the air has become distinctly tinged with arousal. He stepped back from his prey and saw that Min hadn’t just been watching. Her hands had slipped under the business dress the woman was wearing and were currently roaming as they willed under her cloths. “Ooh she’s got a firm ass.”

Nox just stared at her for a minute before finally finding his tongue. “What the heck are you doing?”

Min just smiled “Expanding my horizons, besides I’m planning to share.” So saying she pressed herself against the woman’s back, pushing her into Nox. “Come on, you’ve already fed off her, what’s wrong with taking just a little more.” She smiled at him coyly “And you get me in the deal as well, how can you possibly resist.”

Nox had been around Mingmei long enough to know about her appetites, but she’d never tried anything like this with him. “NO!” his voice is soft but forceful as he yanked the business woman out of Min’s grasp. “She’s satisfied my hunger; she gets to walk home unmolested.” He reached down and grabbed the woman’s portfolio and stuck it back in her hands. Then, after making sure she didn’t look too disheveled, he sent her back to join the throng of humanity.

Min pouted as she watched her go. “What about my needs?” She turned and looked at Nox who was already walking away. She hurried to catch up to and match pace with him. “Santiago hasn’t visited me in forever, and Sasha can’t seem to get it through his head that I’m eager, interested, and available.”

Nox turns to say something when a distant wolf’s howl pierced the evening. The two of them stopped to listen, extending all their senses to determine just what they were hearing.

“Werewolf.” Nox finally says, “and it’s close too.”

Min looks at him skeptically. “Can’t be, what werewolf would be dumb enough to set foot on Santiago’s turf.”

Nox taps his foot as he thinks, finally he shrugs. “Don’t know who, but Santiago is gonna want to know about this violation.” He turns to Min “Head back and tell him that I’ve gone to check this out.”

Mingmei shakes her head. “Nope, you’re not exactly a great fighter and I for one don’t want to deal with Santiago if his main money maker is killed by a werewolf, I’m coming with you.”
11212.title: Complication

112122.content:
Nox sighed, and realizing that she may have a point, waved her to follow. “Fine, but stay close.” He turned and walked away, the were-tiger right on his heels.

The mournful howl of the wolf rolled through the night a few more times. On the streets, pedestrians pulled jackets or loved ones closer, suddenly feeling a chill in the night air. Nox and Min continued, the baying of the wolf only seeming to spur them on.

“It’s alone.” Mingmei said after awhile.

Nox didn’t look at her as he answered. “Makes sense, I haven’t heard the answering howls of a pack yet.” The two had arrived at a small park that currently seemed devoid of life. Nox pulled a small pistol from his jacket and checked to make sure it was loaded and that the safety was off. “Hopefully that means it’s a rogue, and thus alone.”

Min glanced at his weapon and smirked. “You think that little pea shooter is going to take out a were-creature?” she scoffed at him.

Nox ejected a bullet from the barrel and held it in front of her face. “Silver, in the right places, will put any were creature down.” He then re-loaded the round.

Mingmei snuggled up to his side briefly “Oh I like a man who knows how to handle his gun!”

Nox shook his head and looked down at her impish grin. “Don’t you ever stop?”

She shook her head “Nope.” But sobered soon after and stepped away from him. “So he’s in the park, how do we flush him out?”

Nox looked Mingmei up and done, and smiles. “Live bait.”

*****

A few minutes later

Nox is hidden in the bushes. Silently he followed Min as she stumbled her way through the park. Off color and off key singing accompany her bumbling motions as she pretended to be drunk. Nox is forced to admit that her act is very convincing.

“Whoo! I’m blasted!” she said to no one in particular, before flopping down onto a park bench. The bench was facing away from Nox so he couldn’t see Min’s face, but he was able to spot the humanoid form that approached her from the other end of the trail.

“Hey mister!” she waved at him, as if the task was just a little more difficult than usual. “Can you give me directions to Main Street? I’m kind of lost” The man strode over to her, hands buried in the pockets of his jacket, and soon stood in front of her. “Mister?” she said again waving her hands in his face. Nox was unable to tell much about the guy except that he was wearing clothing that was far too heavy for such a warm night


In a flash of movement his hands sailed free of their confines. One grabbed Mins wrist and the other grabbed her neck. Deciding that he’s waited long enough, Nox left his cover; gun already raised, and pulled the trigger. The first shot took her assailant in the shoulder, dropping him to the ground. Mins was up in a flash and kicked the man in the balls for good measure.

Nox jogged over to her side and crouched, pointing the gun too the man’s head before rolling him over for a better look and sees that the man is
112122.title: Night Stalker

1122.content:
The abandoned museum had been a home to the Blood Saints for half a century. There had never been a more perfect haven for vampires than this museum. Old, and Victorian in style, it had at one time been a mansion. Home to some rich family who collected artifacts and antiques. They'd turned their home into a museum. And Santiago had turned them into corpses.

Each of the Blood Saints had their own room, with plenty to spare. A ballroom sat at the front of the building, with a chandelier that was older than the house hanging from the ceiling. There was a kitchen, a pool room, though it was drained of water and they used it instead as a mini-torture chamber when the time called for it, and servants quarters. The perfect vampire haven.

Vega had taken on the wine cellar in the basement to be her room. Though it was smaller than most, it suited her needs. It was dark and enclosed, so even if she no longer needed a coffin to rest, it was like she was in one anyway. A crypt more likely. She kept bottles and flasks of blood on the empty wine shelves. Only the most ancient of vampires could drink dead man's blood. Vega had an aquired taste for it.

A bed sat to the right of the cellar. It was a small one, meant for only one person, unless of course one person was on top of another. And to top it off, a cage sat in the back of the room. Vega was known to play with her food. She often brought home pets, who didn't last long. The cage was currently empty, but Vega planned on filling it soon. With who, she didn't know. But she was sure she'd find someone fun.

Vega always had to find new ways to entertain herself. It was hard in this day and age. Vega found that only three things entertained her these days. Sex, danger, and causing trouble. It was usually a combination of the three that pleased her most. For years, she'd been pleased with just ordinary sex. Santiago was her mate and she had to admit he was good at what he did. But she could only handle the same thing for so long. So she did whatever she could to anger him, to make him violent. When he was caught in his fury, he was always the best lay.

But even that was getting old. She was growing bored and she could tell that Santiago was too. Either bored or he took her for granted. Thinking she would always let him have his way, whenever he wanted it. It disappointed her to think that she was nothing more to him than just good sex.

Even so, it was what made Vega happy. And she was in the mood. She doubted Santiago would be, but she could try. And if he wasn't, she could always go find someone to make her pet for the next few weeks.
1122.title: Vega

choices: Round up a small group lead by Vega.
11221.content:
Vega poised herself outside the door of the master suite bedroom, which Santiago usually occupied during the daylight and early evening hours. However, she could not have put into words what had influenced her to pause at this point. Perhaps she was enjoying the anticipation of something good to come; enjoying the struggle of straining against the excitement as it mounted within her. She drew her long, elaborately gothic fingernails down the dark wood grains of the door, scratching quietly like a cat appealing to enter and smiling all the while as if she found devilish humour in the action.

At hearing no bid to enter, Vega gently grasped the doorknob with a gaunt hand, and then twisted the brass with firm command, promptly causing it to protest with a resonating screech as it turned and bade her in.

The thick layer of pillows, spread abundantly over the worn floorboards, lay cold and uninhabited. The bed to the far corner of the room, neatly made and creaseless, was essentially bare too. Vega vehemently slammed the door closed behind her and sauntered in. She glared around at her surroundings, enraged Santiago had left without bringing her along for the ride. She flung herself upon a cushiony landing, letting her arms sprawl and body sink deep into a slumbered place.

She was disappointed, and it shadowed her pallid features in a dangerous and frightful way. Gazing up at the ceiling, she hungered for his rough touch and she drowned in his lingering scent which was ever present in this room, smelling of Santiago’s sweet blood lust and his ever restless thirst for vengeance. Frowning, Vega ran her hands softly over the velvet cushions, reminiscing myriad occasions of passion and lust.

Suddenly once again, her frown broke into a shimmering smile. This clingy, almost desperate attitude: she was amused by it for it was so unlike her. She wondered vaguely as to where Santiago might have gone to, but growing increasingly restless she realised she could care less about his incessant scheming and how it was undoubtedly associated in some way with tonight’s rendezvous.

No, tonight was hers. How long had it been since she had exercised her wicked talents on the poor innocents of this city? – and for reasons other than necessity? A girl after all must make regular occasions to pamper herself in order to maintain good health, strength and general overall happiness. Yes, tonight was the perfect occasion for some late night sport and foolery. The shadowed streets of the city would not be safe tonight. Vega would ensure it.
11221.title: Seeking Santiago

choices: Vega goes home with the man, has sex, tortures him, and takes him to his cage.
Carl is a vampire hunter, turns the tables on her, and tortures her.
11222.content:
Just as she had suspected, Santiago was not in the mood and all the taunting she had carefully laid out to get his blood boiling did not seem to phase him this time. Vega had noticed him paying special attention to one of the New Dawn Clan lately. She would have torn Delilah apart the first time Santiago looked her way, but she was smart enough to know better. Santiago would have torn her apart. Normally, she was a fierce fighter and was afraid of nothing, but Santiago. Besides, her better half was developing a plan in his devious little brain which would bring New Dawn to its knees and make him their leader. A bigger gang meant bigger funds and more fun.

Vega decided Santiago was a lost cause for her cravings, so she told him she would be gone for a couple of nights and went out into the night to find a new pet. Stalking came easy for Vega, she loved to play with her food. It was so much fun to bring their fear up to the point of death. Adrenaline tasted almost as good as blood itself. She decided tonight was not a night for low class dining down by the docks, she wanted the taste of wealthy blood. Wealthy Californian Wine Country blood would taste just right, and maybe she could score a few bucks on the side.

She willed her body into the air. Flight was not easy for a vampire, it took a lot of strength of mind and stamina of body. Vega had developed and mastered both over her 200 plus years. In no time she was in the Napa Valley. She knew dressed in her Gothic black style she would draw attention, so she used another power she had honed, her dark magic power of imaging. All she had to do was chant a small spell and think who she wanted to look like; she was that person to others, not the scary visage she preferred. She thought of Delilah dressed in skinny jeans, a pink sweater, and pink Keds. Although the thought just about made her sick, she knew fitting in was crucial to her hunting; no one looked more down home chic than Delilah.

Vega came out of the alley she had landed in, and blended in with the humans on the street. She had to choose her quarry carefully. The timid and shy were usually the funnest, because they would get the most agitated the fastest. They were so much fun to play with, but she wanted to find a business man. A vineyard owner this time. Maybe she would take on a whole family, and let her new pet watch their family die one by one. Then she could take him home with her and make him her sex slave for a week or two, or maybe just a night or two. She hadn't made up her mind yet.

As she was walking past a quaint diner, she noticed a man looking at her through the glass window. He looked at her like she was the cherry on top of a hot fudged sunday. Normally, she would have let him see her true self for just a second, long enough to scare him stupid, but there was something about this man that intrigued her. She was not quite sure what it was. She was not even sure if he was a vineyard owner, but she instantly knew she had found her prey. The one thing which fascinated her the most, was she could not read him. Usually within a matter of seconds, she knew everything there was to know about a person. Reading minds was the easiest of a vampire's bag of tricks. She could not read his mind, and it both fascinated and infuriated her. Oh, she would enjoy torturing this one.

Entering the diner, she sat down at the table of the man she had seen through the window. He did not say a word at first. Most men would have tripped all over themselves if a pretty little, tight blond twenty-something girl sat down with them. Maybe even would have asked what the hell she thought she was doing sitting at his table, but not this guy. She knew he was not a vamp and she knew he was totally human, she could hear the blood running through his veins. She wondered if maybe he were a werewolf, but then she thought, No, not a werewolf. Don't stink like wet dog.

He put his hand out and said, "Hi, I am Carl. What's your name?"

She took his hand and shook it and returned cattily, "I am Delilah."

"Glad to meet you, Delilah. What made you come in and sit down at my table?"

"I'm not sure. I found your smile interesting, I guess."

"Would you like something to eat or drink?" he asked her, brandishing that charming smile again.

"No thank you," she told him, trying harder to read him without success. He reminded her a lot of Santiago with his dark good looks, which should have been a warning, but she was too intrigued with him to catch the signs.

"What do you want then?" he asked her point blank.

"I don't know. I am new here. Can you tell me where I can find a room?" she asked coquettishly, throwing the hint she was available to go home with him.

"Well, there is the Napa Valley Inn, which is nice and reasonably priced. Are you here alone?"

"Yes, I just had to get away from my mundane life. So, I took off and this is where I landed," Vega slyly told him, of course, he did not know how true her statement was, which made it even more fun.

"How nice you have graced our small community with your anything-but-mundane presence." His smile got bigger. "You could always stay in my guest room at my farm if you don't have the funds to get a room."

Awww...there it was, the invite she had been waiting for. This was turning out to be so much fun. She liked this coquettish banter. Usually, she hunted in secret and her victims never knew she existed until she went in for the capture or kill. She was looking for different and she had found it. Lucky her, unlucky him.

"Wouldn't your wife and kids be just a little put out if you show up home with me unannounced?" she asked, twirling a lose strand of hair between her fingers.

"No wife, long gone moons ago. One daughter, living in New York, hasn't bothered to write or call in a very long time. She won't call until she needs something, probably money, but then again, she has made it pretty big as a model. Maybe she won't call for anything." The look on his face darkened a little when he talked of his daughter's defection. He let his guard down for just a second. She instantly got a vision of his daughter. She looked a lot like the image of Delilah she was wearing now, young and blond cutsie type. The block was back up almost as fast as it had went down. Vega couldn't read him anymore than that.

"Oh, sorry she has made you feel so bad." She put her hand on his, sensing that maybe Daddy had a thing for his daughter, and that is why he had become interested in her, she said, "I wouldn't hurt you like that."

Taken a little aback by her forwardness, he snatched his hand away like he had been caught being nasty with her or something. She stood up and acted like she had gone to far and was apologetic, "I am so sorry. I didn't mean to offend you. I like you, your nice."

His eyes softened as he fell for her false sincerity, "Oh you didn't offend me. I just was being overly sentimental about my daughter. It was my fault." He whispered in her ear so no one else would hear, "Would you like to stay at my place or would you like a ride to the inn?"

She whispered back with soft vampishness, "I will stay with you."

Vega walked out into the chilly night air, not really feeling the cold. She went to the only cherry red pickup in the lot, unlocked the passenger side door, climbed in and started the engine with the keys as he had instructed her to do, before he went up to the counter to pay for his meal.

She just didn't know what to think of this guy. There were warning bells going off with her vampire senses, but she also thought herself invincible so she didn't heed them. She knew she could handle any situation, having been put in quite a few situations of close call over her vast years. She knew no fear of anything or anyone, but Santiago.

He climbed into the truck and they pulled out into the night.
11222.title: Find a new pet.

1131.content:
Jin always practiced swordplay at the docks. There was something about smelling fish and river water that really fine tuned his senses so he could concentrate on every muscle, every movement, every breath, every swish and sway of his swords as they sliced through the air at invisible foes. He practiced as often as he could, finding it both refreshing and stimulating.

Jin was always looking for action. Whenever there was a fight, he was always there to help out Santiago. He didn't know why he was so loyal to the vampire, Santiago had no honor whatsoever, but Jin found that he was attracted to Santiago's power. Such an ancient force, cruel and heartless, but a vampire who stood the test of time and still lives to tell his tale. Jin admired that.

Swinging his swords, he danced them above his head, making light foot work before he brought them slicing down, their light metal blades shining in the moonlight. Jin looked up at the moon. In a couple days, it would be a full moon. The wolves would be restless. Jin hoped one would come his way. Of all the creatures of the night, Jin hated werewolves most of all. Shaggy mutts that didn't deserve the romantic title given to them. Jin would kill them all if he could.

A noise to his right brought Jin's eyes back down to earth. He paused for only a second, listening for a noise to tell him where his stalker was. A short intake of breath gave him away and Jin spun, swords flying. It was a flurry of motion and had Jin really wanted to kill the person, they wouldn't have known what hit them. But Jin brought his blades to a stop just centimeters away from the person's neck.

The man didn't seem phased.

"Still playing with blades, I see," the man said, bringing a hand up and pushing Jin's sword away. Jin let him move it a bit before he lowered both to the ground.

"What do you want?" Jin asked, bitterly as he turned around and went back to his swordplay, moving and spinning, showing off some, but listening to the man. He still didn't fully trust him.

The man grinned and sat down on a pile of crates to Jin's right, watching the vampire move so gracefully. "I have a proposition."

"I don't do business with hunters," Jin said coldly. For that's what this man was. A hunter. A slayer. A mortal who took on immortals. Jin hated his kind. He'd seen too many good vampires brought down by hunters like him. And one day, Jin suspected that one would bring him down.

"I think you'll want to hear this," the man said.

Jin growled and sheathed his swords on his back before turning towards him. "Caleb, you test my patience."

"It seems your master and I have a common enemy."

Jin frowned. "I'm listening."

"I need you to help me kill them."
1131.title: Jin

choices: Sasha lets her have her way.
1132.content:
Mingmei laughed when Sasha startled as she brushed some of his blonde hair out of his eyes. She'd come into his room seeking company. He quarters were lonely these days. It had been so long since Santiago had sent her out after anyone. She was growing bored. The abandoned museum that the Blood Saints called home was big and practically empty. She hated it, but she went where Santiago went. She was his property afterall.

"Jesus, Ming," Sasha breathed out, his voice a little shaky, still somewhat startled to find her in his room. She'd woken up him from his rest. "You scared the crap out of me."

Chuckling softly, she sat on the edge of his bed and leaned over him, stroking the side of his face. Sasha looked confused at the gesture. God, it had been so long since she'd been with anyone. She'd grown up having men force themselves on her nearly every night. It had become such a habit of hers that when Santiago bought her and the nightly visits had stopped, she'd felt just how addicted to it she'd become. It felt as though she wasn't doing her duty. As if there was a job she wasn't completeing.

"I didn't mean to," she whispered, leaning down and kissing his forehead softly. He frowned a bit deeper from the contact before he brought his hands up and placed them on her shoulders, pushing her away from him. She gave him a grin. "Sasha," she said to him plainly. "I want to fuck you."

"What?" Sasha squawked. He laughed incredulously and pushed her back further as he sat up. "Ming, I'm flattered and all, but no way," he said with a vehement shake of his head. "You're like a praying mantis. You'd bite off my head and then fuck my body just because you need a lay."

Mingmei frowned at that. "That's not nice to say," she whined, pouting a little as she ran her fingers over Sasha's chest and shoulders. He looked uncomfortable and grabbed her wrists, pushing her away.

"It's true," he argued, swinging his legs off his bed and pulling on a pair of jeans as he stood up. Mingmei watched him move. He didn't have the grace of the other, older vampires yet. He still moved like a human. But his body was practically perfect. Every inch of him was clear skin and his muscles were defined, solid, toned. She'd been attracted to him from day one.

"Even if it is," Mingmei said, standing up too and following him as he walked over to his closet and pulled out a hoodie. She smiled at his wardrobe. He was still so human, even after 150 years. "I wouldn't kill you," she said evenly. "Maybe maim you, but I won't kill..." she purred as she pushed up against him, shoving him into the wall, where he let out a laugh that sounded half nervous, half real. "Come on, just one quick fuck."

"No," he said and pushed her away again. "You're my clan member, I don't want to make this awkward."

Mingmei groaned as he slipped past her and walked back over to his bed, tidying it up. "Sasha, you're a vampire, start fucking acting like one."

Sasha froze and stopped what he was doing. He turned his head to look at her, hurt written all over his face. "What's that supposed to mean?"

"It means you're still so human I can pracitcally hear your heart beating," she told him and watched as anger, sadness and humor flickered across his face all at once. She didn't give him time to argue. "Clan members are meant to fuck," she said. "Santiago and Vega do it all the time."

Sasha wrinkled up his nose. "Don't remind me." He turned and headed to the other end of the room, pulling open a chest where he had his weapons stashed. He pulled out a handgun and stuffed it into the back of his jeans. "They're mates, they're supposed to do that. You're not my mate, you just want my body."

Mingmei didn't fail to hear the pride in that last statement. She grinned. "We don't have to be mates to have sex."

"Yeah we do," Sasha said, closing his weapons chest and turning to square off against her again. "It would be too awkward."

Mingmei sauntered over to him, watching his shoulders tense and he gulped when she got near to him. She ran a finger along his breast bone, biting her lower lip. "It doesn't have to be," she whispered. "Vega and Caspar fuck all the time."

Sasha's eyes widened at that. "Are you serious?"

Mingmei pressed her body into his, her mouth near his neck, he held his hands in front of him, holding her off but not really pushing her away. She smiled, she was getting somewhere. "You've been with this clan for how many years and you've never noticed?"

"Well..." he started, but she cut him off.

"Let me open your eyes," she said and started kissing his neck.

The Blood Saints recruit some slayers and hunters to help.
1141.content:
Sasha's head whipped to the side as Santiago backhanded him with a ferocity that would have killed anyone who wasn't immortal. For a minute Sasha saw stars. Pain exploded in the side of his head from where he was still reeling from the slap. After only a moment, his head started to clear. He could feel his brother's hands on his arms, holding him up and in place. Thank God for Vanya.

When Sasha brought his head back around, he found that Santiago was pacing back and forth, looking much like a caged tiger, which was making Mingmei look both distressed and interested at the same time. The other Blood Saints were watching him, waiting for him to say something. Vanya tightened his grip a little before letting go and coming to Sasha's side, looking him in the face.

"You alright?" Vanya whispered.

Sasha nodded and brought a hand up to his head. He felt the gash on the side of his face that was already healing, almost closed. Santiago could sure pack a whallop. And this time Sasha hadn't even done anything to deserve it. Santiago had just been attacking the messenger.

Earlier, Sasha and Vanya had been spying on Aubrey's club under Santiago's orders. Santiago and Aubrey had been going head to head for a while now and there were rumors floating around that Aubrey was gathering his allies close to him, ready to attack Santiago and finish this feud once and for all. Santiago had been furious at the rumors and for a week now had been stressed out and ill tempered. He'd sent the twins to spy on the night club to see who was coming in and out. They'd dreaded to tell him that they'd not only seen Braeden, the leader of the Lupine werewolf pack, but also Ivy and Sloan, the Alpha females of the She-Wolves. Sasha distantly wondered if there had possibly been a way to tell Santiago without getting the punching bag treatment.

"Who else did you see?" Santiago spat suddenly and Sasha and Vanya turned their heads to face him.

Vanya spoke up this time, since Sasha was still gathering himself from the blow. "A few other Lupines and She-Wolves. There were a couple wolves from other packs and at least one were-snake. But they could just be going there for fun."

Santiago glared and growled. Sasha frowned when Vanya took a step in front of him. Sasha loved his brother, but sometimes he got too protective. "It doesn't matter if they go there for fun or not. Either way, they're showing their support for that whelp, Aubrey."

"We need to take him out," Nox said from where he sat perched on a small stone wall.

"Him, and the leaders of the packs who follow him," Maddock added quietly from where he leaned against the wall.

"A bloodbath," Vega laughed, licking her lips. "My favorite."

"We need a plan."
1141.title: Sasha

choices: Get Sasha and get the hell out of there.
1142.content:
Vanya sat nervously in his chair, watching as Santiago swirled a finger lazily in his chalice, the blood there staining his finger red. But Santiago wasn't paying the blood any attention, his eyes were on Vanya and he didn't look happy. It was never a good thing when Santiago wasn't happy.

Vanya and his twin brother Sasha had followed Santiago for 150 years. It was a long time, maybe not to Santiago, but to Vanya it was. He hardly remembered his mortal life. All he really knew was Santiago and the ways of the Blood Saints. But it wasn't like the twins had ever been given a choice. They'd watched Santiago murder their father and then the ancient vampire had turned on them, biting both of them and giving them the immortal life. They had to follow him, or be left out in the cold.

"I need you to do something for me, Vanya," Santiago said, his voice slipping into that familiar ancient accent Vanya had grown accustom to. It was the accent of a dialect of a language that was dead to the modern world. No mortal would recognize it.

Vanya shifted uneasily in his chair. "What can I do?" he asked nervously. It wasn't often Santiago came to him. For important tasks, Santiago usually left them to Maddock or Jin or even Nox. He rarely gave the twins an important job to do. They were young, with much room for error.

"I need you to take care of a pest problem I have," Santiago said, finally withdrawing his finger from the blood. He licked it clean, all the while watching Vanya, who frowned, not understanding.

"Pest problem?" Vanya asked.

"Yes," Santiago nodded and leaned back in his chair, hooking one leg over the arm and swinging it, looking lazily and bored. "That fool Braeden has aligned himself with Aubrey's clan. That whelp is gathering forces. I need to show Braeden and the other wolves that they've chosen the wrong side."

Vanya's eyes widened. "You want me to go after Braeden?"

Santiago snickered but looked annoyed. "Do you really think you're that powerful? To take on an Alpha male?" Vanya shook his head. "At least you know your strengths," Santiago observed, growing serious again. "No, you need a more formidable opponent. Someone whose death will affect Braeden's entire pack."

"Did you have someone in mind?" Vanya coaxed, not really liking where this was going. He could kill someone, he'd done it before, but normally it was out of defense or during a battle. It wasn't outright murder. But how could he deny Santiago anything?

"A She-Wolf," Santiago said plainly and Vanya grit his teeth. "Your choice of which one, but I will warn you, the older ones are quite deadly."

"You want me to kill a She-Wolf?" Vanya asked quietly. "But they're not even aligned with Aubrey's clan. They're neutral. They-"

"They are Braeden's greatest weakness aside from the members of his own pack," Santiago cut in. "Kill one and Braeden will understand the message."

Vanya shook his head. "But-"

"Do you know why I brought you in and gave you a place in this clan?" Santiago asked, sitting straight in his chair again and leaning forward. Vanya stiffened. Santiago only looked like that when he was making a threat. Vanya knew when to keep his mouth shut. "Because when I killed your father and turned to kill you, you stepped in front of your brother."

"To protect him," Vanya whispered, remembering the horrible nightmare of that day.

Santiago nodded. "Yes, you protect your brother with a ferocity worthy of a vampire. You have potential. Another hundred years and it may be you I am fighting for power with."

"I don't understand," Vanya said, though he thought maybe he was starting to see where Santiago was going with this.

Santiago stood up, showing that this discussion was almost over. "Vanya, you are a worthy vampire, your brother is not. Sasha is expendable. I would really hate for anything to happen to him."

Vanya kept the growl from escaping his throat as Santiago left the room. He leaned back in his chair. Great. Kill a She-Wolf or sentence his brother to death. What choice did he really have?
1142.title: Vanya

choices: Find someone to take it out on.
115.content:
Caspar watched as Vega walked into Santiago's room. She closed the door behind her and a few minuts later, he could hear the moans and sounds of sex. He closed his eyes for a second, imagining what it would be like to get between those gorgeously pale legs of Vega's. To feel her body against his, to run his fingers over her skin, to hear her moan under his touch.

Caspar opened his eyes at the thought. The one thing he'd ever truly wanted and the only one he could never have. Not without sentencing himself to death. No one pissed off Santiago, no one. And Caspar knew that someone sleeping with Santiago's mate was a good enough reason for Santiago to be pissed off as any.

Turning around, Caspar made his way down the stairs that opened into the ballroom. The Blood Saints had made their haven in an abandoned museum, that had at one time been a lavish mansion, before Santiago killed its owners. Caspar didn't hold it against him, it was a nice house.

Stopping as he was about to enter the kitchen, Caspar put a hand on the doorway, a small smile touching his lips. It lasted only a second before it turned into a scowl. For such a big house there sure wasn't enough privacy.

"It's not nice to spy," Caspar called out, not turning around or looking anywhere but the spot in front of him. He heard a cold chuckle ring out behind him, echoing around in the ballroom.

"Says the spy," the voice called. Caspar growled and turned finally, quickly spotting the vampire who'd been watching him. Maddock sat on the railing on one of the balconies that overlooked the ballroom. He leaned lazily against the wall, swinging a leg while the other was scrunched up near his chest. Maddock's porcelain mask that he never took off glinted a bit in the dim lighting. He was twirling a knife, leaving marks in the wood on the railing.

Caspar had never really gotten along with the other vampire. But he'd never done anything about it. Maddock was from Ancient Egypt, older than most vampires and possibly even older than Santiago. He had skill they hadn't even begun to see. Caspar enjoyed a good fight, but he'd never fight Maddock, not unless he knew the other vampire didn't have the ability to just kill him by blinking.

"What do you want?" Caspar asked in a low voice, annoyed.

"Nothing," Maddock answered, still twirling the knife. "Just observing vampire nature. Wondering what it's like to love something you can't have."

Caspar smiled, though there was malice behind the gesture. "Are you going to tattle?" he asked in a mocking voice, but the question was still real.

"Me?" Maddock asked, putting a hand to his chest. "I never tattle." He jumped off the railing and onto the balcony, walking back behind the red drapes that blocked off the room behind. Caspar clenched his fists, but Maddock called to him, "Unless the price is high enough."

"Fuck you," Caspar whispered under his breath, not caring if Maddock heard it or not. He'd said it to the vampire's face before but the other didn't seem to care. In fact, he'd laughed at having it said to him and Caspar wouldn't be surprised if Maddock enjoyed being sworn at or called names. He was just that type of vampire. Loved to get under people's skin.

Caspar felt fury rise up in him at the situation. Of Maddock's taunts, of Vega's untouchableness, or Santiago's impending wrath. He needed to release some of this anger.
115.title: Caspar

1211.content:
"You don't have an appointment tonight, Sloan?"

Sloan looked over at Lavender, the youngest member of her pack, who'd asked the question. "Not tonight, no," Sloan answered cheerfully. Sloan was thankful for that. Although she loved what she did, there were some nights she just needed to take off and have fun with her girls. Tonight, Sloan, Lavender, Bliss and Wren had decided to head to Eclypse, the nightclub owned by the vampire Aubrey. It was quickly becoming their favorite hangout, not to mention a safe haven for wolves and vampires and other dark creatures. No one messed with each other inside Eclypse. If they did, there'd be a brawl that would claim more lives than it was worth. So Aubrey and the others in the New Dawn clan did everything they could to keep it peaceful.

If there was a vampire to make nice with, it would be Aubrey. He took care of the people who followed him. Sloan, along with her co-Alpha Ivy, had decided they would offer their support to Aubrey should he need it, but they would never officially align with him. The She-Wolves were neutral unless called upon.

"Will Lanny be there?" Wren asked from where she walked ahead of them, her voice quiet, her gait smooth. Sloan and Bliss chuckled as Lavender's face blushed slightly.

"Maybe," Lavender admitted.

Bliss put an arm around Lavender's shoulders, giving her a squeeze. "You gonna have fun with your boy toy tonight?" she laughed.

Lavender pushed her away. "I don't know," she said, then to get the conversation off of her, she nodded her head towards Sloan. "What about you, Sloan? Mitch is working tonight."

Sloan paused for a moment and raised her eyebrows at the others, who were watching her with curiosity. "Mitch?" she asked, a smile spreading across her face. "Why would I care if Mitch was working?"

"Oh come on, Sloan, the guy wants you," Bliss said. "Badly."

Sloan shrugged. "Then he knows how to get me," she said simply. "Tonight I'm hanging with my girls." The others chuckled and Sloan laughed with them, though her thoughts went to Mitch, one of the Lupine wolves. Sloan often did business at the club. After Lavender had been attacked a few years back by a vampire John, the She-Wolves had wanted to find a way to protect their girls as much as possible. It had actually been Aubrey's suggestion that they use the club, so if anything should happen, there would always be someone there to help. Sloan had taken up the offer. And since then, she did most of her business in the club. She usually sat at the bar, where Mitch worked, and waited for her trick to show. She didn't miss the way Mitch watched her or eyed her John's, sizing them up when she walked off with them. She'd just never thought about it. She was used to people being attracted to her. And Mitch was a friend. That's all. Just a good friend who liked to look out for her.

"What about you, Wren?" Lavender was saying as Sloan came back to the present. "You've got someone tonight?"

Wren shook her head. "No," she answered. "There weren't any suitable proposals."

"You're too picky," Sloan said. "Some of those guys may have been nice."

Wren shrugged her slender shoulders. "Maybe, but they're not for me. I'll send them your way."

The girls chuckled as they entered the club.

Get Delilah to go to Aubrey's club.
1212.content:
Bliss stood up on a ladder, restocking one of the top shelves in her book store. It was a good thing she didn't have to do this often, her store really didn't get that much business, but she had a few loyal customers who came in to do all their shopping. Most of them were teenage goths, looking for spell books or poetry or whatever kids were into these days. Bliss suspected that part of the reason some of them came back was because they enjoyed the atmosphere of her store. That dark, gothic, mysterious feel of it.

Truth was, Bliss knew most of those books were full of crap. Some skeeze wanting to make money off of a teenage fetish for all things magic. She could sell books that said just about anything and her teenage customers would think it was the real deal. The truth was, it took a lot more than fancy words and blood oaths to get black magic to work. Give a kid a Quija board and all of a sudden they think they're mediums.

Bliss would never give those kids the real books, the ones that gave away secrets no one should know. Books of the covens, of the packs, of the clans in the world. Books written by vampires, by werewolves, by witches and hunters and anything else who dealt in the black arts on a daily basis. Those were the books Bliss kept strictly for herself and for her pack and maybe a few stray true witches here and there.

The bell above the door rang, startling Bliss into almost losing her balance on the ladder. She let out a yelp and grabbed hold of the top rung to steady it. She caught her breath and called out, "We're closed," trying to peek around the bookshelves to see who had just come in.

"Rats." Bliss chuckled. She knew that voice. Delilah. "And here I was, my heart set on a cheesy romance novel." Bliss grinned and watched the blonde vampire walk into the aisle she was working in. "Morning, toots."

Delilah. One of the most cheerful, happy-go-lucky vampires Bliss had ever encountered. She loved the girl like a sister. She was the closest friend outside of the pack that Bliss had. Cute as a button, soft as a teddy bear, and yet she could kick anyone's ass if they messed with one of her friends. It was a good thing she was on Bliss's side.

"Well if it's a cheesy romance you want," Bliss chuckled and climbed down the ladder. "Take your pick of gentlemen. Would you like Fabio or Fabrizio?" Delilah laughed and began fingering the books on the shelf next to her, reading some of the titles.

"Neither," she said. "I need a man with intelligence."

"Hard to find one of those these days," Bliss answered and set the box of books she'd been reshelving down. She stretched her arms up above her head and yawned. "You going out tonight?" she asked, walking towards the counter.

Delilah followed her, her footsteps soft, barely noticeable. Bliss went behind the counter while Delilah jumped up on it and swung her legs, looking all the picture of a bored teenage girl instead of the vampiric killing maching Bliss knew she was. She supposed that's what she liked about her friend so much. Her innocent exterior. Most vampires she knew, and some werewolves, were all about image. That cool, I'm better and older and wiser than you type image. But with Delilah, she really didn't care. She just wanted to have fun.

"I was thinking about it," Delilah answered, chewing on a fingernail. "I'm getting hungry."

"Do a little hunting?"

Delilah sighed and pouted. She turned and gave her friend a pathetic look. "I wish there was something worth hunting in this city. But everyone's just so fatty. And everyone likes sushi. You know how sick it makes their blood taste?"

Bliss laughed and rang out the cash machine for the night, locking it in the lock box beneath the counter. "Well I'm sure if you go to Eclypse tonight there will be some young hot stud to feed on," Bliss said, referring to the nightclub owned by Delilah's clan leader, Aubrey. "Give him a few Long Islands and you're set."

"I just wish we had better hunting ground," Delilah sighed. "I really wish I could go to the East Side."

"And get torn apart by Santiago and his nutcases?" Bliss squawked, locking the front door. "I love you too much, sweetie, to let you do that."

Delilah suddenly looked mischevious. She hopped down from the counter, eyes flashing, a smile spreading across her face. "Then come with me," she said. "Bait and trap, it's been so long since you've done with me."

"No way," Bliss shook her head and pocketed her keys, heading for the backdoor. Delilah was hot on her heals. "I am not messing with Santiago."

"Please," Delilah begged. "We won't stay long. Just one meal and then we can leave. He won't even know."

Bliss sighed and turned to look at her friend. Delilah pulled out her best puppy dog eyes. Great. Now what was she supposed to do?
1212.title: Bliss

choices: Someone else is at the door.
1221.content:
Elvina struck a match and lit the three candles on the coffee table in the center of the room. When all three wicks were lit, she blew out the match and laid it into a small Sake cup. She glanced around the room, taking in the mood. It was almost perfect. Candles were lit on just about every hard surface. The coffee table sat in the middle of the room, a leopard fur lay on the floor in front of a fireplace, which was sporting a nice fire. There were couches and pillows and a bar. Elvina had made this her room. She even had a locked chest with supplies in the corner.

The room was in the back part of Eclypse, the vampire, Aubrey's, club. The She-Wolves had made a deal with Aubrey. He'd come to them, in the beginning, asking them if they wouldn't like to use his facilities for their business. It was right after Lavender, the She-Wolves' youngest member, had been attacked while on a job. Ivy and Sloan, the Alpha females, had agreed that it would be safer and wiser to use a familiar place. In return, they provided Aubrey's most esteemed guests with services and also helped out the New Dawn clan if ever there was an encounter with a hunter or a Blood Saint. Aubrey didn't charge them, but the girls came to the club often enough and bought drinks and pleased customers, bringing them back each night, that it was worth while to have them there.

Elvina was one of the top earners. Aside from Sloan, who seemed to have an unnatural ability to attract men, Elvina brought in the most customers and was the most sought out She-Wolf. She wasn't as picky about her clients as the others were. If they paid well enough, they were good enough for her. Money was money and that's about the only reason she was in this business. Yeah, there were nights when the sex was real good, but that was just an added bonus. Most nights, it was strictly business. Just a girl, working for her money.

Tonight was one of those nights. She really didn't feel like being here, but she was and she had a client coming. She wasn't sure who to expect. Ivy had set up the appointment and Elvina had forgotten to see who it was before she came here. A part of her hoped it wasn't anyone important, so she could just lay back and let him go. But another part of her yearned for someone who would peak her interest. Someone who would make the night worthwhile.

Well, there were other ways to make nights worthwhile. She checked the time. She still had a few minutes before her John showed. That gave her time to make things a bit more interesting. She crossed the room to the bar. She poured two drinks, one for herself and one for her client. Martinis, the way she liked them. She downed hers in one gulp, shaking her head at the burn before pouring herself another. Then, she reached into a hidden compartment on the bar and pulled out a small packet. Cocaine hardly had any effect on a werewolf. So Elvina mixed hers with silver dust. Not too much. The stuff would kill her if she ingested too much. But just enough to make it worthwhile.

Spreading out a line on the bar top, she rolled up a bill and quickly snorted it. The burn was short lived. Almost immediately, her body started to relax. She blinked heavily, before smiling to herself, feeling the drugs take an effect in her system. That was more like it.

Elvina unbuttoned her pants and slipped them off, left in her black lacey underwear. She left her shirt on, a small black top that left her stomach exposed. Lace sleeves went down to cling to her fingers. It was her favorite get up.

She pulled her hair back and flung it over her shoulder as she laid down on the couch, positioning herself in wait for the John. The room was a euphoric hue now. And when the knock on the door came, Elvina was a bit more accepting of the night that awaited her.
1221.title: Elvina
