elvina ran to the intercom,Quickly depressed the button and yelled "aburey ivy come here now!" she vaulted over to the couch the smell of human and fresh blood was quickly eroding her self control.

Elvina looked at the persons face. it was a boy no more than 18 his stomace was riped open, the only thing keeping his intestins from falling out was his right hand. In his left was a blood soaked package she quickly opened it inside was half a paper Elvinas eyes widened as she skimmed down the brown and wrinkled paper "WHERES THE REST HUNTER" she spat at him. With his free hand he pointed to his head he was to weak to talk.

"What is... oh my god" said Ivy as she came rushing into the room followed closely by solan,aburey and fin. Elvina passed the note around with the same reaction. The boys eyes where wide with fear."Where is the rest" aburey said as he reached down and riped the sleave revealing a tattoo of the hunters "hunter" he added with venom in his voice. "He cant speak he's to weak buut he poinded to his head earlier" chimed in Elvina ' well we have to save him call an ambulance. "It's to late his heart is slowing down" said aburey. Ivy slowly steped up to him "Then we must turn him". "what no" said solan "solan we ned that information" said ivy. "I agree" said aburey "ivy will you do it he would be safer there with you ladies"."i dont take guys in even to hide them human vampire or wear i dont" said ivy" well it's either that or the guys take him but i think they kill him if they tried to turn him you have the self control" said abury. she glared at him but knew there was no way he would let any of his people turn him into a vampire and time was running out. The boy's face was pure horror he weakly shook his head as ivy 's canine slowly elongated her eyes turned a brillian mezmerizing green seh bent low to his ear, "this will hutr" and then she sunk her teeth deepinto his shoulder a loud scream of agony riped from the boys mouth sending chills down fin's spine.

"Fin go make shure no one come's to the door" fin grumbled as the screams died away. Why do i have to guard the door he thougfht to him self with a sour face. He heard the res of his clan and ivy's pack come running down the hall. Poor fin was no match for them he tried to stand his ground but was trampled getting up and disting his clothes off he went to watch the turning
12212.title: Someone else is at the door.

choices: Go to the East Side to inspect the crime scene.
1222.content:
Ivy sat in a corner booth of the Eclypse, the club owned by Aubrey, who was the leader of the New Dawn vampire clan. It was a pretty popular hangout for all supernatural beings. Even as she sat there, she saw a lot of familiar faces making in the crowd. Some vampires, some wolves, even a few of the more rare beings. Ivy spotted a few of her girls out on the dance floor. Sloan, her co-Alpha, was dancing with someone Ivy had never seen before. Tatum and Wren seemed to be just dancing for the sake of dancing, and Lavender was there with Lanny, her boyfriend. Ivy smiled to herself. She was happy for Lavender. It took a brave person to recover from what the girl had gone through, being attacked by a John. But she had. And Lanny was a great guy. Cute too.

Ivy was too busy watching her girls on the dance floor that she didn't notice as someone slipped into the booth with her. It was a few seconds before she reached for her drink and found that it wasn't where she placed it. Almost immediately, her senses kicked into overdrive and she spun in her chair, wondering what imbecile had that gall to toy with her. But her anger instantly dissapated as she found it was Aubrey who now sat next to her, a quaint smile on his face.

"Good evening, Ivy," he said smoothly, his voice like silk. Aubrey had that type of power over anyone. He was smooth and soft and sly. Even Ivy, who found the objects of her desires to be more feminine, had to admit that Aubrey was the type of vampire that could send a chill up anyone's spine. In a good way of course.

"Aubrey," Ivy breathed, instantly relaxing. She had nothing to fear from this vampire, who had given girls so much. He'd allowed them the use of his club as a home base for their services. "I hate it when you sneak up on me," she said, though there was a playful glint in her eyes that always seemed to be there.

Aubrey chuckled softly and moved her drink back over, gliding it across the table without sloshing the liquid inside. That was a vampiric talent. "Forgive me, angel," he said. That was another thing about Aubrey. He called all the girls he knew, "angel." Ivy knew it annoyed some of them, but she found it endearing. If he called you that nickname, it meant he thought highly of you and respected you.

"You're pretty busy tonight I see," Ivy remarked, nodding her head toward the crowd. Aubrey looked over and scanned everyone, though a rather unapproving quirk had graced his lips. Ivy frowned. "Something wrong?"

"There were hunters here today." Ivy froze at the words. It was the last thing she'd expected. Hunters? Here at the club? She was immediately outraged that she hadn't been told about it. Hunters coming to a vampire hangout was never a good thing. Why wasn't there a blood bath in here? Why didn't Aubrey seem too perterbed?

"Here?" Ivy squawked.

Aubrey nodded, pulling a flask out of his back pocket. It was a silver color, not real of course, with a rose engraved into it. Aubrey loved roses. He unscrewed the top and took a swig before closing it up and slipping it back into his pocket. Ivy never asked what he kept in there. Alcohol had no effect on vampires and Ivy didn't think that Aubrey would just drink whiskey for the aesthetic reasons. She had always just assumed it was blood.

"Yes," he nodded. "During the day. While I slept."

"What happened?" Ivy asked, wondering what the hell was going on.

Aubrey sighed and leaned back. "They spoke with Ulric." The vampire was referring to a werewolf friend that he had. Ulric was in the Lupine pack and a good friend of not only Aubrey but the She-Wolves as well. "Said this was a warning. They respect vampires who don't kill their food, so they respect an establishment that promotes that sort of being."

"What was the warning?" Ivy asked.

"It seems a young couple and their infant son were killed two nights ago on the East side," Aubrey said.

Ivy sucked in a breath. "East side? Santiago."

"It would seem," Aubrey said, but then ran a hand over his face, looking more human than Ivy had ever seen him. "But they were killed by a werewolf."

Ivy shook her head. "No one in my pack would do that. Nor in the Lupine pack."

"I know," Aubrey said. "But if it happens again, they're not going to risk letting us live anymore. They're going to kill everyone. Werewolves and vampires. We need to find who did it and make sure it doesn't happen again."

Ivy leaned back, mirroring Aubrey's dejected look. "How do we do that?"
1222.title: Ivy

1231.content:
Lavender pulled her shirt on, straightening it watching herself in the mirror. She turned around, examining her whole body. Her tube top was leopard print and she wore red pants that were tiger print. It was an odd combination, but it was her style. What was more important, this was Lanny's favorite outfit of hers. He said it made her look primal. Primal and "hot as fuck." She smiled to herself as she could practically hear his voice inside her head.

Lanny was by far the best thing that had ever happened to her. Her whole life, she'd been lost and confused and when she was bitten by a werewolf, things only got worse. She'd joined the She-Wolves and had found a home with them. For a while, she'd thought things were going to be okay. Though she didn't particularly like prostitution, she did it, to help out her pack. But when that vampire had attacked her, she'd been just as lost as ever. The nightmare of that night still came back to haunt her. The only difference now was that she had Lanny. The first guy that made her feel like she was worth something. They'd been together for nearly a year now. In two days would be their one year anniversary. It was the longest Lavender had ever stayed with a guy without fucking him. That had to mean something.

They were planning on celebrating tonight. Maybe they'd go out to the Eclypse, the nightclub owned by Aubrey. Or maybe they'd find something else to do. Whatever it was, Lavender was happy to be spending the time with Lanny.

Looking at the clock, she realized that he'd be there any second. Lavender gave herself one more look in the mirror before she jumped up and ran to her kitchen. Lavender lived in a small, one bedroom apartment. She shared it with Manhattan, but the other girl was never home. So it felt like she had the place to herself.

As she was straightening up the kitchen, for what reason she had no idea because Lanny was a bigger pig than she was, her cell phone rang. She fumbled with the phone and finally answered it.

"Hello?"

"Lavender, sweetheart," came Sloan's voice over the phone. Sloan was one of the Alpha's of her pack. She was also a dear friend and almost a mother figure to Lavender.

"Hey, Sloan," she said, hopping up onto her counter and swinging her legs, kicking the drawers with the heel of her boots. "What's up?"

"Not much, dear," she said, then got right down to business. "Look, I can't talk long, I've got a client waiting for me. But I just wanted to call and let you know to be careful tonight."

"Why? Is something wrong?" Lavender asked, fear instantly spiking in her chest. She hated when she got so nervous. But ever since the attack, she'd been jumpy and scared of just about everything.

Sloan said something to someone in the room before answering Lavender's question. "No, nothing's wrong. There's just been a lot of hunter activity lately. I'm looking out for my girls. You'll have Lanny with you tonight, right?"

"Yeah, he should be here any minute," Lavender said.

"Good," Sloan answered. "Well have fun tonight. If you need me, just call. I'll have my phone on. This client likes it when I'm distracted." Sloan gave a funny laugh to which Lavender chuckled. Sloan always got the weird clients.

"Night, sweetheart," Sloan said.

"Night, Sloan," Lavender answered and then hung up. Just as she did, the doorbell rang.
1231.title: Lavender

1232.content:
Manhattan walked down the sidewalk, her heels clicking seductively on the pavement. She was dressed to work tonight. A plaid mini-skirt, a gray button up shirt that showed off her well endowed cleavage, and the black choker she always wore when out on the job. She was hoping to make a little extra cash tonight. Business had been slow lately and rent was due on the apartment she shared with Lavender. It wasn't like she couldn't just ask Ivy or Sloan for a loan, but she liked to be a self-sufficient person. She liked doing things for herself.

Nights in the city were always Manhattan's favorite time of day. Not only because she had more of a chance of finding a vampire to fuck, which was her absolute favorite, they all fucked like gods, but also because she just liked the look of the streets in the dark. The orange glow of streetlights, the mystic look of the steam traveling up through the sewer drains. The lack of people traveling down the street. She loved it.

Some of the other girls never understood why Manhattan worked the streets when Ivy could score her some big time players if she really wanted them. Hell, Manhattan could barely explain it. Perhaps she just had a fetish for danger. She was an adrenaline junkie. Fucking a stranger, not knowing if he really was just there for the sex or for something else, it was thrilling to her. Exciting. Plus, no one fun got pass Ivy's screening. Manhattan couldn't stand some of the prissy rich boys that Ivy scheduled for her. She wanted the real guys. The guys who had no other way to get laid than to pay for it. The guys who just wanted to fuck and fuck hard and fuck long. Those were her favorites.

It was a dangerous life, but Manhattan loved it. Sure, to some it was degrading, but to her, she was experiencing new things every night. She was seeing another side of the city besides just the ones she saw under the shelther of Ivy and Sloan's protection. She liked this gritty life.

A car pulled up beside her, startling her out of her thoughts. But she instantly recovered and gave a seductive grin at the window. It was tinted and she couldn't really see inside. She bent over, making sure to expose her cleavage a bit more. To her delight, the window rolled down. There was a man sitting inside. She didn't recognize him. He had black hair and a goatee. He looked fun.

"What can I do for you?" Manhattan asked, coming closer to the car, trying to look as pleasant and irresistable as possible.

The man smiled at her and scooted closer to the window. "How much will a thousand dollars buy me?" he asked, his voice smooth and low.

Manhattan's eyes widened at that. She was unable to keep the shock off her face. That was a hefty price. She'd struck gold. "Honey, that will buy you an entire evening of anything you want."

"Anything?" he asked, eyes mischevious. Manhattan felt a warning bell ring in her head at the tone of his voice. But this guy seemed too good to pass up.

"Anything," she assured him.

He reached over and opened the door. She looked inside and saw he was alone aside from his driver. There was champagne and glasses in the car. It looked like he had a fun night planned. But still, that tone he'd used. She was starting to question what he had in mind.
1232.title: Manhattan

choices: It's one of the Lupine Pack.
124.content:
Tatum yawned and stretched her arms above her head. She was walking home from another exciting evening at Eclypse. Nothing big had happened, but the club was always fun. It had looked like Elvina had a good client. Some big hot shot vampire from the looks of it. Lucky girl. And Ivy had been as fiesty as ever. She'd left a decent sized hicky on Tatum's neck. She smiled at the thought of the Alpha female. She loved Ivy, she really did. She just wasn't sure if she was ready to commit yet. And she knew Ivy wouldn't hold it against her if she ever told her so.

Turning a corner, Tatum felt her cell phone vibrate and she grinned. Reaching into the pocket of her army cargo pants, she pulled it out. Ivy's name flashed in the screen. She flipped it open.

"Babe, I just left you like five minutes ago," she said.

Ivy's laugh made Tatum smile even wider. "I know," she said. "I know, but I miss you already."

"Oh yeah?" Tatum said haughtily.

"Yeah," Ivy agreed. "But that's not the reason I called. "

Tatum scoffed playfully. "Way to break my heart."

"I'll make it up to you later," Ivy said in a rather seductive voice. Tatum chuckled but gave her Alpha her undivided attention. "Listen, Lavender just left in a huff. I think her and Lanny had a spat. Ulric's over here trying to cheer the kid up but he looks like his world has just fallen apart."

Tatum nodded, but remembered Ivy couldn't see her. She was actually surprised to hear that Lavender and Lanny had a fight. The two of them were perfect for each other. She didn't know what could tear them apart. "Want me to go check on her?"

"Could you?" Ivy asked. "I would do it, but I need to be around when Elvina's client leaves."

"Sure thing, babe," Tatum said. "I'll head over to her apartment right now. Manhattan's probably home by now, but I think she's gonna need someone a little more compassionate than that."

Ivy laughed again. "Right. Thanks, love!"

"Any time," Tatum said. "Hey what are you doing tomorrow? Wanna catch breakfast?"

"You bet," Ivy said. "I'll pick you up at seven."

"Good god, girl, I don't get up that early."

"Fine, seven thirty," Ivy said. "I can't wait that long to see you."

"You're flattering."

The two laughed, said their goodbyes and then hung up. Tatum pocketed her phone again, still smiling. But that smile soon faded as she caught a whif of the air. She'd been so preoccupied on the phone that she hadn't noticed the change in the air.

Someone was following her.
124.title: Tatum

choices: Knock Him Out (bring him to the pack)
1242.content: Tatum turned towards the noise and stifled a gasp as she saw an attractive man about her age in fairly weather-beaten clothes and struggling to stay standing. “Help me please.” The man had a bad series of gashes across his chest that was obviously caused be claws of some kind. Normally Tatum wouldn’t have been so friendly towards a stranger but she noticed that he smelled of a wolf. She cautiously stepped towards the newcomer and asked him who he was. “My name’s Ted Lupin. My friend brought me with him on a business trip because he heard that there were werewolves in Chicago. I got jumped by a group of renegade vampires.”
1242.title: A Rogue Wolf?

12423.content: Tatum stepped closer to him before she placed her hand on Ted’s cheek before looking him in the eye and whispering in his ear, “If you really want to see how she-wolves live around here, follow me.” “I’m not from here, I’m from England and am here visiting a friend from out of town.” Tatum pulled him along and walked towards her apartment with her new “friend” in tow.
12423.title: Teachthe basics of being a Lycan

124231.content: “I really shouldn’t be doing this; I can’t control my wolf that well.” Tatum smirked and suddenly wrapped Ted in a hug, “Don’t worry about it I can handle a wild pup, after all I’m only a pup myself.” Ted hugged her back and kissed Tate’s cheek before the two young pups continued walking to their destination.
124231.title: Take him to her place

1242311.content: As they arrived at Tate’s door Ted stopped suddenly. “What’s… eep!” Tatum had no time to finish her question before Ted picked her up bridal-style and, after finding her spare key, carried his new-found friend into her own apartment. Tatum’s first thought was to slap this wolf for his boldness but she felt a strange comfort as she laid in his arms while he carried her to her bed. Ted laid Tatum on her bed and stood back to admire her form.
1242311.title: A pleasant Walk

choices: She accepts him as a client.
She declines him, hoping to pursue a relationship.
125.content:
Wren smiled playfully at the man sitting across from her. He was an older man, probably in his late forties, but he looked very distinguished. He was a business man, some big shot executive in a computer software company or something. They hadn't discussed his work yet, so Wren didn't know. He wasn't married and didn't have any kids. Both were something Wren liked in her clients. And he was completely and utterly human.

It was usually Ivy who screened the clients of the girls. Wren trusted Ivy's judgement on people. That's why she'd yes to meeting this guy. Ivy had okay-ed him, put his name on the safe list, and let him have his pick. Wren knew he'd been with Sloan and Elvina both. She'd asked the other girls about him and they had both said he paid well but fucked better. Not the most elegant of descriptions, but Wren knew what they meant.

So when he'd asked Ivy if he could pay for Wren's services, Wren had decided to give the man a chance and invite him out to dinner. It was the way she screened her clients. She didn't sleep with just anyone. Wren liked gentlemen. She liked men who knew how to treat a woman right. She didn't want to be just a tool or a quick lay. She wanted to be an endeavour for the men she provided her services to.

So far, this guy, whose name was Jack Lacey, was looking promising. She'd let him choose the spot to eat dinner, the first test of a man's worth. Jack had chosen a Sushi place. It wasn't as lavish as some of the places her prospective clients took her to, but it was nice. She liked it. Not to mention, the wolf inside her loved to eat raw meat and any excuse she could find to do so in front of a client, she would take it. Most of her clients didn't know she was a werewolf. Hell, most of them didn't know werewolves, or any other creature of the night for that matter, even existed.

"How do you like it?" Jack asked and Wren smiled again at him.

"It's good," she said. It was time for test number two. "But I can't get a hang of these chopsticks."

Jack laughed, picked his napkin up and wiped his mouth before leaning across the table. "Let me show you," he said. With both hands, he placed the chopsticks into Wren's slender fingers, molding her hand into the right position gently. She watched his face as he did so. He was so concentrated, so willing to help. He passed test number two. Wren had known how to use chopsticks, she just wanted to see how he handled it. "There, now pinch these fingers together," he said looking up at her.

"Like this?" Wren asked, purposely pinching to hard and the California Roll slid out of her grasp. She smiled and let out a laugh. "I don't think I'll ever get this.

Jack chuckled and took the chopsticks from her hand. "Here, like this," he said, picking up the food with the chopsticks and holding it up for her to eat, holding his hand underneath it to keep it from dripping on her black Kimono-like shirt.

Wren smiled at him wontingly and took the food from his chopsticks, chewing it and swallowing. He watched her the whole time. "I think I'll stick forks," she said, looking down in a feign of shyness.

"You'll get it," Jack said, smiling at her again. "You just need to practice."

He was a good man, she decided. But she was a bit distressed over the fact that she was beginning to like him. She liked to keep these things very business-like. She didn't like letting her emotions get involved. It could get dangerous. But the way he was looking at her, the kindness in his eyes, maybe she was willing to give him a shot?
125.title: Wren

13.content:
You've chosen the Lupine Pack. Now which character would you like to follow specifically?

Here's the picture again:
13.title: Lupine Pack

choices: Take Vega now before she attacks.
Wait a little longer and see.
1311.content:
A strange, ghastly wind swept New York City, suddenly igniting faint thunder in the distance. Gradually came light, tantalizing rain. In Central Park, only litter stirred. If anything, the beasts wouldn't be noticed in the still darkness.

Beyond the crooked trees were thin shafts of light cast from the mystical full moon above the world.

A twig snapped.

"Finally," muttered Ulric, chuckling out of amusement. "Some bait."

A couple strolled on a path; one tall male in a beige jacket and a blond woman speaking indistinctly on her cellphone, now holding up an umbrella. Little did they knew that something lurked near them.

Ulric stared, not daring to say a word, for he saw a pale, scrawny woman dressed in gothic attire creeping from behind. Her dyed-red hair whipped around as she glanced into the darkness with immortal eyes, searching for any sign of a trap.

He recognized her as Vega of the Blood Saints and cringed once she looked in his direction. Strangely she did not see him. He knew that once a vampire from the Blood Saint sees a werewolf, there would be utter chaos. Especially with her.

Vega continued stalking her prey. He exhaled sharply and tensed. He glanced over his shoulder to meet his best friend's gaze. Mitch smiled, baring wolfish fangs, his skin bristling into pitch-black fur. As much as he wanted to take her down off guard, he didn't want the other humans to be infected. He gulped dryly, poised to act.
1311.title: Stalkers of the Night

choices: A fight breaks out in the club.
1312.content:
Mitch leaned against the bar, feeling the beat of the music vibrate through his bones. Eclypse was bouncing tonight with people. A lot of stray vampires lurked here and there, hoping to feed. Mitch had to keep his eye on them. He, along with Ulric, helped the New Dawn Clan and Aubrey keep the vampires who frequented the club in line. It was a house rule that no vampire was to take the life of their victim. They were to feed and let go. Let the person go home and wake up in the morning thinking they had one hell of a hang over. In all the time that Mitch had been helping out Aubrey, only one vampire had ever broken that rule. And it turned out it was a Blood Saint.

Being a bartender in this club had its perks. He got in free, got free drinks, got paid well, got tipped well, got the respect of the vampires and werewolves and everything else the frequented the club, but most of all, Mitch got the respect of the She-Wolves who used the club to do their business. And there was one She-Wolf in particular that made Mitch love his job.

Sloan.

One of the most beautiful, funny, smart, and sweet girls Mitch had ever come across. She was an Alpha of the She-Wolves and she was also the main attraction in the club whenever she came around. People paid good money to aquire her services. It bothered Mitch sometimes. Some of the guys she attracted weren't the best. He kept a close eye on who she walked off with every night. If anything happened to her, there'd be hell to pay.

"Mitch!" he turned when he heard his name. Quinn had come up to the bar, grinning like an idiot. Mitch snorted. Quinn was the youngest vampire in Aubrey's clan. He was young, naive, and sometimes cocky. But he was a good kid. Loyal and honest. Which Mitch supposed he got from Fin, one of the vampires who sired him. He sure as hell didn't get it from Lesmana, the other who sired him.

"Hey, kid," Mitch said, walking over so he was standing in front of him. "What's your poison?"

"O Positive?" Quinn tried, chuckling already at his own joke.

Mitch snorted. "Fresh out."

"Fine," Quinn pretended to be upset. "How about Captain on the rocks."

"You got it," Mitch said, pulling out his bottle of Captain Morgan. He poured Quinn a generous helping, something he did for all of his friends. He set it down in front of him and said, "Good hunting."

"Thanks, man," Quinn said, raised his glass and toasted Mitch before sipping it and walking off. Mitch chuckled a bit.

Putting the bottle away, he scanned the crowd again. His eyes settled on a group of girls who had just entered. His heart skipped as he saw they were She-Wolves. Wren, Lavender, and Sloan to be exact. And Sloan was looking as lovely as ever. She wore a white sundress that rode up high on her thighs. Her blonde hair fell down around her shoulders and she just seemed to glow with beauty. She was gorgeous.

But Mitch would never pay to sleep with her. He would never degrade her like that. And because he had morals, she was off limits to him. Unless he could convince her to try a relationship, which was something she adamantly protested against ever doing.

The group made their way down onto the club floor. Mitch watched them as they went, already dancing even before they got to the dance floor. Sloan moved like an angel.
1312.title: Mitch

choices: One of his pack accidentally killed someone.
1321.content:
Braeden lay in his bed, wearing nothing but a pair of black slacks. He had his hands crossed behind his head and his eyes closed. It was early in the morning. The vampires had retired to their respective resting spots and most of his clan and others were just getting to bed. But not Braeden. He loved early morning. He usually went home early in the night and got to sleep so he could wake up and enjoy the quiet, peaceful hours before the world awoke.

Things were slow during these few quiet hours. The noise dimmed, trouble seemed to fade, and Braeden could let himself relax. As Alpha male of his pack, he dealt with a wide array of troubles on a daily basis. This was always his time to get away from that all.

With his eyes closed, Braeden listened to the birds outside his window. It was something he seldom had a chance to hear anymore. Living in the inner city, there wasn't much wildlife except for pigeons and Blood Saints.

Braeden's quiet morning of peacefulness was suddenly broken as someone started knocking harshly on his front door. Braeden opened his eyes. The sun was up, so it wasn't a vampire. Probably one of his pack. He was almost tempted to let them keep knocking for a while. But the tone of their knock was a bit off, something was wrong.

Sitting up, Braeden stood and walked out of his bedroom. He owned his own house on the outskirts of the city. He didn't spend much time here, opting to stay in the Lupine haven in the city most of the time. But sometimes, he just needed to get away from it all.

Walking to the front door, he pulled it open and found Ulric standing outside, panting, looking almost frantic. Braeden sobered instantly. When Ulric got worked up, it was for a good reason.

"Braeden," Ulric breathed, trying to catch his breath. Braeden guessed that the wolf had run here. He didn't see a car anywhere. "We have a problem."

"What is it?"
1321.title: Braeden

choices: There's a knock on the door.
1322.content:
"You again?"

Donovan smiled at Manhattan, who stood in the doorway wearing nothing but her black lace underwear, bra, and see through button up shirt that was only buttoned in one place, exposing her stomach. Her black wavy hair fell around her shoulders. She was ready for action.

Donovan hadn't come to Eclypse with the intention of making use of the She-Wolves services. But once he'd gotten there and had heard that Manhattan was waiting for a client, he couldn't pass up the opportunity. Manhattan was his favorite. They were friends and both of them knew that the sex was merely business. That's why he liked her so much.

"Me again," Donovan confirmed. "Were you expecting anyone else?"

"That's three times this week, Donnie," Manhattan said, though he could see the playfulness on her face. She actually looked excited to see him. Probably because it meant that she would fuck someone she knew instead of risking it with a total stranger.

Donovan shrugged. "What can I say? You're addicting."

"You just love me for my body," Manhattan fake pouted.

"You better believe it," Donovan answered and nodded towards the room. "You gonna invite me in or what?"

Manhattan smirked and stepped aside, allowing him to come into the room. He walked inside and flopped down on one of the couches. The room was small, but it was lavishly decorated, especially for Manhattan. There were two couches, a small bar, and pillows spread around on the floor. It was a good room for a frisky romp.

"You just going to sit there and let me do all the work?" Manhattan asked as she closed the door and locked it.

"If that's what you want to do," he answered, grinning.
1322.title: Donovan

1331.content:
Lewis stood outside of Eclypse, the club owned by Aubrey, his clan leader. It was a brisk night and he was doning his denim jacket. He didn't care what Lanny might say, denim studded jackets weren't just a style of the 80's. Even if they were, Lewis was bringing them back.

The club was already hopping. Mitch was working tonight as a bartender there and a few of the other Lupines were inside, living up the night. He'd come to see Ulric, really. But the other wolf hadn't shown up yet and Lewis hadn't wanted to go inside. He wasn't a huge fan of the club when it was busy and bustling. He liked Aubrey well enough, but the club just wasn't for him. It was better when there was a lesser crowd and Lewis didn't feel like he was hiding a secret from so many people.

Lewis was still getting used to being a werewolf. There were impulses and nuances he was still trying to get used to. Whenever he was around a mortal, a regular human being, it seemed to him that he stood out like a sore thumb. Like everyone in the world would be able to tell that there just wasn't something right with this one.

Truthfully, he didn't know how the others did it.

The Lupine pack was more a family to Lewis than any he'd ever had. They taught him things about being a werewolf, about dealing with the urges. But it took time. Even the most veteran wolves still sometimes fell prey to their own urges. Primal urges. Guttural urges. Mainly, the urge for blood.

Being a werewolf wasn't like being a vampire where you had to drink blood to survive, thank god. Lewis didn't think he could handle that. But wolves still got the hunger to taste blood, to feel flesh in their mouth, to shred skin with their teeth, to tear meat with their claws. Every once in a while, the animal showed up. And it was those urges that Lewis had the most trouble controling. The animal urges, the ones he wasn't used to as a human.

Lately, it had been getting worse. It always got worse around the full moon, but for some reason, this lunar cycle was the worse so far. It was still three days until the full moon but already Lewis was feeling the pull. Most werewolves lose themselves during their first few full moons. That's why Lewis stuck with the pack. They could help control him when his animal instincts took over. They wouldn't let him hurt any body. Lewis had never fully given in, he'd never fully lost control of himself. But he felt like this time was different. This time he actually might lose himself.

Ulric was going to be his babysitter until the full moon was over. But he was late and Lewis was getting antsy. Besides, it wasn't really fair to make Ulric watch him for four days straight. It wasn't fair for Ulric. The other wolf had a lot of things to deal with, he didn't need to be babysitting pups. And Lewis had overheard a few patrons of the club talking about something that may help. Something that soothed the urges, that mellowed the body.

Pixie dust. That's what they'd called it. Lewis doubted it was actual pixie dust, though it was entirely a true possibility. No, it was a drug. A drug for an immortal. Lewis knew where to get some, he'd heard who sold it and where to find him. The only question was, would he rather wait for Ulric, or try out this drug?
1331.title: Lewis

Marcella goes to meet with Santiago
145.content:
“So, what’s on your mind?”

It should have been odd that Marcella asked now, slim fingers pulling the short leather skirt over her hips. Dark eyes took a moment to glance over her shoulder at the still naked vampire sitting on the edge of the bed, a sheet pulled carelessly over his waist. Silver hair was tangled and hanging carelessly in his face, and she took a moment to push it behind his ear. “Nothing,” he said, shaking his head and lying to her like she couldn’t recognize it after six hundred years.

She smiled. “I don’t believe you Aubrey. You know I hate it when you try to lie to me.”

He shook his head and smiled back at her. “It’s nothing I can’t handle.”

She sighed, rolling her dark eyes at him and planting a kiss on his lips. “You can be so difficult sometimes,” she told him with a smile, before standing up and reaching for her shirt. They were lovers, of a sort, but they were not in love. She had no illusions about their relationship, and once she had understood what it was, she had been fine with it. She wished that it could be love, but after six hundred years, she was not the romantic girl she’d once been. She had thought she’d been in love with Santiago as well, and now he was fucking that vampiress whore of his.

It wasn’t really her concern anymore, but she did have her pride, and it stung, at the moment. Still. She did not need Santiago, just as she did not need Aubrey, but out of the two she knew which one she would rather be with. A hand ran through his silver hair again, drawing his distracted eyes. “I know something is bothering you.”

He smirked, eyes falling to her form. A hand reached out to rest on her hip, fingers digging in a little more tightly than intended. “Only that this lovely creature in front of me is about to leave.”

She laughed, turning away to pull a white shirt on. “You should be used to it by now.”

“I know,” he said, sighing slightly. “Will you be at the club tonight?”

She shook her head, running fingers through her hair to try and untangle it. It wasn’t working out very well, but she imagined that by the time she got out of the room and onto the street it would fix itself. Still, she felt the need to do something with her fingers, because she didn’t want Aubrey to know how much it did bother her that he wouldn’t confide what it was that was on his mind. She imagined it was probably the Blood Saints moving in on his territory again. They’d been getting bolder lately, particularly Vega. A snarl wanted to rise in her throat at that.

It seemed like such a human thing, she thought wryly. To be kicked to the curb by the younger woman.

“Maybe,” she said after a moment, adjusting her appearance with quick and expert fingers. “I have business of my own to take care, and I’m afraid dear that you’re just not invited.”

He mock pouted at her, reaching out a hand and pulling her back to the bedside, fingers sliding under skintight clothing and running against her skin. She ignored the faint chill that his touch sent up her spine, smiling down at him and letting her hands run through his hair again. “Don’t act like you mind,” she smirked. “You’ve never interfered with my business before, and I know you’re not interested now.”

His pout deepened. “You offend me, madam. To imply that I do not care…”

“Is a perfectly reasonable statement.” Her smiled took the sting out of it, and leaned down to kiss him again, this time longer and deeper. “Do not pretend that we are other than what we are, love,” she ran her fingers along his cheek, studying him carefully. It was his eyes that really got her, those eyes that were so much younger than hers, and yet still full of so much life. It made her remember what it was to be human, and that was a dangerous thing for any vampire. “I have accepted that I am not the one for you, do not make that harder by teasing me so often.”

A frown creased his perfect features. “Marcella, I meant no offense. Are you alright, this is not like you?”

She sighed, resting her forehead on top of his for a moment. “Old wounds ache tonight,” she whispered, kissing his skin one last time. She forced a smile, before turning away. “I might see you later,” she said with a wave of her fingers. “But don't wait up for me.”
145.title: Old Wounds

info.brief_description: Vampires, werewolves and the politics that rule them.
info.description:
My Dark Angel


The characters in this interactive were all created for my novel "Aubrey: Hush Still Monsters" . However, I didn't get to use them all. So I wanted to give them a home.


This interactive is going to consist of a multitude of characters, stories, and plotlines. Basically, anything goes. XGC, so feel free to do what you'd like. All I ask is that if you're going to do a graphic sex scene, please put some plot to it. I'm not against sex scenes, but I don't want this to turn into a full on porn. But other than that, anything goes. ANYTHING. You have your warning.


Characters

Like I said, there's going to be a ridiculous amount of characters. But at least you'll have a lot to choose from. The pictures were made about 3 or 4 years ago, but I thought they would help with visualization.


Blood Saints
The vampire clan that's a bit more evil than the rest.
The kill, they hurt, they're fighting for power and control.




Santiago- The leader of the Blood Saints. He's an ancient vampire. None really know how old he is except Santiago himself. He's vicious and cruel. He's fighting for control of the vampires in New York. He despises werewolves and would like to see them either enslaved or killed.

Maddock- Second in command of the Blood Saints. He's from Ancient Egypt. He keeps his face hidden, saying the world can never know what he looks like. Whether he is beautiful or hideously scarred beneath his mask is unknown. He's not as cold hearted as Santiago, but he'll do anything for money or blood lust.

Nox- A modern vampire. He was turned in the late 1800's and has adapted well with the times. He's loves technology and is a wonder with computers. Santiago asked him to join the Blood Saints so he could scam money and help fund them. He's not as cruel as the others, but he's loyal to Santiago.

Vega- She's only about 300 years old, but she's mastered her vampiric powers. She performs dark magic and can conjour images and shadows. She has a taste for torture and loves to watch people suffer. She's scary to look upon. She's also Santiago's mate.

Jin- A vampire from Japan whose about 450 years old. He's highly trained and mastered in the martial arts. He's like a bodyguard to Santiago when Maddock isn't around, but Santiago hardly needs one, so Jin spends most of his time training or challenging other vampires to a fight.

Mingmei- The only Blood Saint who isn't a vampire, Mingmei is a were-tiger, one of the few of her breed. She was born in China and grew up a sex slave. Santiago bought her and she's his property. She's a seductress and highly deadly to Santiago's enemies.

Sasha- One of the youngest Blood Saints. Only a mere 150 years old. He is a twin to Vanya. The two grew up in Russia together and were sons to a man Santiago killed. He turned both Sasha and Vanya into vampires. They've followed him since. They're pranksters and hooligans. But very dangerous.

Vanya- Sasha's twin. Like his brother, he is 150 years old. He is the more mature of the two and the ferocity for which he watches out for his brother is what attracted Santiago to the two. Sasha doesn't know that Santiago values Vanya over him and Vanya wants to keep it that way, for his brother's sake.

Caspar- A vampire from London, he's about 200 years old. He's heartless, cruel, and merciless. He kills without warrant. It's said that he was the infamous Jack the Ripper that stalked the streets of London in 1888. He has never accepted or denied the accusations. He's also in love with Vega.



She-Wolves
The She-Wolves is an exclusively female pack.
Most of them are prostitues, but it's not a membership requirement.




Sloan- One of the two Alpha females in the pack. She's an optimistic, chipper girl and she's also the top source of profit for the She-Wolves. People will pay top dollar to bed her and she doesn't just sleep with any John. She's a high class companion. In wolf form, she's has tannish brown fur.

Bliss- She owns her own bookstore and is a very practical girl. She dabbles in black magic, but would never use it to hurt anyone. She's not a fighter. She doesn't openly seek prostitution, but if a John asks Sloan specifically for her, she'll usually go along with it. In wolf form, she has dark brown fur.

Elvina- Originally from France, she is another of the top profit earners for the She-Wolves. She's probably the most dangerous of the pack. She knows how to fight and to kill. She also has an addiction to drugs. She can be a bit cold and cruel, but she loves her pack members. In wolf form, she has black fur.

Ivy- The other of the Alpha females of the pack. She's practical and down to earth. She doesn't sell her body for money, but she helps set up deals, to make sure her girls are safe. She's skilled with weapons and has almost perfect aim with a handgun. She's in love with Tatum. In wolf form, she has light brown fur.

Lavender- The youngest of the group. She's into the punk look and dresses wildly. She dies her hair a pinkish-purple color. She started off as a prostitue, but after a vampire John tried to kill her, Ivy pulled her out of it. Now she has a boyfriend, Lanny, whose part of the Lupine pack. In wolf form, she has brown fur.

Manhattan- The only African American woman in the She-Wolves. She takes part in the prostitution. She screens most of her clients through Ivy, but she also does some street work. She's tough and knows how to handle herself. Her brother, Edgar, is in the Lupine pack. In wolf form, she has black fur.

Tatum- She's loud and funny and sportsy. She lightens up a room when she's in it. She doesn't have much of a bloodlust, but she will defend her pack to the death. Like Bliss, she only takes part in the prostitution when someone specifically asks for her. In wolf form, she has light brown fur.

Wren- The most soft spoken of the pack. She's elegant and graceful. She has the ability to be one of the top profit earners for the pack, but she's picky about her Johns. No one holds it against her. She's beautiful and calm, but moves like she's dancing when she fights with knives. In wolf form, she has whitish gray fur.



The Lupine Pack
Contrary to the She-Wolves, it is an exclusively male pack.
They're fighters and are aligned with the New Dawn vampire clan.




Ulric- He's third in line for Alpha. He's also very close friends with Aubrey, the leader of the New Dawn clan. His best friend is Mitch. He's funny, happy go lucky and smart. He can fight well enough, but he's small in size and that sometimes gives him a disadvantage. In wolf form, he's has blondish brown fur.

Mitch- Second in line for Alpha, he's a strong fighter. He's a bartender at Aubrey's nightclub. He's quick and dangerous and may come off a little cold, but he's actually a kind, caring person. He's got a thing for Sloan, of the She-Wolves. He's good with knives and guns. In wolf form, he has black fur.

Braeden- The Alpha male for the Lupine pack. He's the leader. He's extremely smart and very dangerous. Though some might say he's a little too careful and he doesn't attack until someone attacks him. But his goal is to keep people alive, so no one can blame him. In wolf form, he has dark brown fur.

Donovan- An African American man, he's a bit of a player and a show off. He likes to be in the spotlight and he's one of the most frequent clients of the She-Wolves. He talks a big game and fortunately for him, he can fight as well as he says he can. In wolf form, he has dark brown fur.

Lewis- One of the youngest werewolves in the area, he's only 16. He grew up in an abusive house and when he ran away, he was bit by a werewolf and left to die. Braeden took him in. The others watch out for him. He's a bit cocky, but he knows he still has a lot to learn. In wolf form, he has light brown fur.

Huan- Having grown up in Mexico City, Huan came to the states to escape a hunter. He met Braeden through Edgar, who befriended him when he first came. Edgar and Huan are best friends now. He's a good fighter and is pretty loyal to his friends, though he has a bit of a bloodlust. In wolf form, he has black fur.

Edgar- He is Manhattan's brother and Huan's best friend. He looks out for his sister a lot, even though she's older than him. He's a bit of a smart alec, but he's also a genius. He's highly intelligent and can use his quick wit and knowledge in a fight when strength just won't cut it. In wolf form, he has black fur.

Lanny- He's a practical joker. He loves pulling pranks and is a bit of a pyro. He always has a plentiful supply of firecrackers on hand. He gets into trouble a lot and though he can fight fairly well, he always seems to take the brunt of an attack. He's Lavender's boyfriend. In wolf form, he has a tannish fur.



New Dawn Clan
They are a pretty diplomatic clan in that they don't kill for food.
They're seen as powerful and because of that are often under attack.




Aubrey- The leader of the New Dawn clan. He's quiet and poetic. About 350 years old, he's travelled all over the world looking for the vampire who turned him and left him to die, but he hasn't found him. He's trying to find something or someone who will make his immortal life worthwhile.

Lesmana- She's from Ancient Egypt. She's a bit of a villain compared to the others. She gets in trouble with Aubrey a lot for taking too much from her victims. She liks to taunt her prey and she sometimes uses her vampiric powers to take advantage of people. She's Fin's mate and she thinks of Quinn as her son.

Fin- Nearly 500 years old. The second in comman of the New Dawn clan. He's almost silent, only speaking when it's absolutely necessary. He's tough and cold but is very loyal to his friends. He's vowed to stick with Aubrey through anything. He's Lesmana's mate and thinks of Quinn as his son.

Duncan- One of the younger vampires, he's only about 50 years old. He was bitten when he was 25, by Aubrey, who did it to save his life after another vampire left him for dead. He's loyal to Aubrey to a fault. He's short tempered and loves to toy with his prey.

Quinn- The youngest vampire in the clan, he's been a vampire for only 10 years. He was bitten when he was 20. He's still learning the ways and he still has trouble dealing with what he's become. He's shy and quiet and not a very good fighter. He thinks of Fin and Lesmana as his parents, since they sired him.

Delilah- She's been a vampire for nearly 200 years. She grew up in Holland but came here during World War II. She met Marcella, who took a liking to her and brought her into the clan. She's sweet and childish. But she can fight and she's been known to beat vampires twice her age.

Gideon- He was turned into a vampire during the American Civil War. He was a slave during that time. Santiago came to the plantation where he was and slaughtered everyone there, but for some reason left Gideon to turn into a vampire. Gideon has sought to kill him ever since. He's bitter, but doesn't let it control him.

Marcella- She's nearly 600 years old. She's beautiful and smart. She's also dangerous and has a very defined mastery of her vampiric powers. She was Santiago's mate but he threw her out when he got tired of her. Now, she has an on again off again relationship with Aubrey.



Notes:


Feel free to do what you want with this. Create any type of stories that you want. I just wanted to give these characters a home.

For authors who are prolific in adding to this story or who add extremely good additions, you may receive a merit badge.
